# Managing igraph object
`codexplor` offering functions to manage `igraph` object. turn an edgelist into an igraph object, and filter it across the way. 

Once you have a network such as a network of internal dependancies within a project (see `get_text_network_from_project`)

- Turn your Citations Network into a directed `igraph`  network with ![.](https://img.shields.io/badge/{igraph}-bold?style=flat&logoColor=black&logoSize=2&label=get_igraph_from_df()&labelColor=green&color=black)

        netig <- codexplor::get_igraph_from_df(net) 
        
- Once you have an igraph object, zoom on a precise function with 
![.](https://img.shields.io/badge/{igraph}-bold?style=flat&logoColor=black&logoSize=2&label=filter_igraph_egonetwork()&labelColor=green&color=black)

      filter_igraph_egonetwork(netig, "a_node")

- Turn it into an interactive `networkD3` dataviz with ![.](https://img.shields.io/badge/{igraph}-bold?style=flat&logoColor=black&logoSize=2&label=get_networkd3_from_igraph()&labelColor=green&color=black)

- And manage the interactive `networkD3` dataviz with ![.](https://img.shields.io/badge/{igraph}-bold?style=flat&logoColor=black&logoSize=2&label=get_networkd3_from_igraph()&labelColor=green&color=black)
